body.name: Striking Viking Shaving Cream for Men, Vanilla Scented (5.3 Oz) Shaving Cream Mens - Sensitive Skin Shaving Cream That Helps Moisturise, Protect and Soothe the Skin
deliveryMessages: FREE delivery Wednesday, February 21 on orders shipped by Amazon over $35. Order within 18 hrs 17 mins
features: Moisturizes, Protects and Soothes: A shaving cream designed for sensitive skin that combats shaving-related irritation, including burning, micro cuts, dryness, tightness, and stubble itch, leaving your skin feeling clean, fresh, and invigorated.
Easy To Use: Create a dense lather effortlessly, whether using a shaving brush or not. The creamy texture effectively softens and lifts the beard, ensuring a close and comfortable shave.
Smooth Razor Glide: The lather enables an excellent razor glide, effectively ensuring the protection of the skin against nicks and cuts.
Vanilla Goodness: Indulge in the captivating Vanilla experience with our Striking Viking Shaving Cream, meticulously crafted to elevate your shaving routine to new heights.
Professional-Grade Formula: Developed with precision, this shave cream boasts a professional-grade formula that caters to the needs of discerning men who appreciate quality grooming products.
Striking Viking Confidence: Trust the Striking Viking brand for an incomparable shaving experience with a cream that seamlessly blends style, functionality, and a delightful unscented fragrance.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Yes, even bearded men need “aftershave”
reviews.reviewText: My husband has had a beard “forever” and enjoys a wide variety of Viking products. This review is for the aftershave balm, and I think it’s an overlooked product that some bearded men forget about.Even if you have a full beard, there are usually areas where you shave down to the skin. For my husband, he takes a little off the top of his cheeks and then shaves his neck. His neck in particular can become a little irritated after a clean shave and this product does a great job healing his skin.He shaves his neck about 5 times a week and usually applies this immediately after shaving. It sprays on cleanly, but he’ll then kind of massage it into his skin. He finds it soothing and hydrating and immediately neutralizes the irritation of shaving. Once a week he trims his beard, shaves, and then showers. Applying the balm after the shower seems to work just as well, with the delay not interfering with the recovery.It smells great, and the vanilla can be paired with other scents as well. For example, he has a more earthy sandalwood beard balm and the two scents compliment each other.Like I mentioned earlier, he has several Viking products in his rotation and they are all great. And they all compliment each other. This after shave balm is highly recommended!My star ratings explained:5 stars = Exceptional. I recommend to friends.4 stars = Exceeded expectations.3 stars = Met expectations. Satisfied with purchase but not overwhelmed.2 stars = Failed to meet expectations but usable.1 star = Avoid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't go far
reviews.reviewText: First let me start by saying I have (and enjoy) several of the Striking Viking products, and overall I do like this one as well - the vanilla scent is a very pleasant one, the label/packaging is nice. I think my only concern is how much I need to use each time to soothe my shaved facial areas and just how long this 4oz bottle will last? It just rubs in SO quickly it doesn't seem to go very far!I guess time will tell, but until then I shall enjoy the smooth, pleasant scent of my freshly shaven skin thanks to Striking Viking Vanilla After Shave Balm!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great pre shave oil, makes your shave soap lather AWESOME
reviews.reviewText: It's been a while since I used a pre-shave oil so I thought I would give this one a shot. I'm a clean shaven guy, going more than 2 days without shaving usually drives me nuts. To test it out I went 3 days which for me was a decent amount of growth, enough to clog a cartridge razor for sure.One thing I noticed right away... Get your reading glasses out if you want to read the directions on the bottle... That's a lot of words in a small place to basically say: put a dime sized bit on your hand and massage it into your clean face. After lamenting the fact that I apparently need reading glasses, I managed to read enough to figure it out and easily measured out that dime sized bit of oil into my hand. Let me tell you, you can kind smell the vanilla from the bottle but when you rub it into your face it smells AWESOME. It's a rich deep vanilla, not an annoying fake smelling scent at all. Once applied I grabbed my Bump Patrol shave gel, and proceeded to lather up my face. Immediately I noticed that it did a MUCH better job of building a lather up. The Bump Patrol is great for avoiding shaving bumps for me but it's always been a bit weak on the lather... by adding this oil first I got a great lather.Now... I do shave with a DE safety razor so I get a pretty good shave all the time but my Alpha razor felt like it performed exceptionally well with my face all oiled and lathered up. Not a single nick, even with a few bumps, and after shaving my face already felt moisturized. Definite win!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: First, the scent of this pre shave oil is wonderful. A very rich and warm vanilla. Not girly but not so macho a woman can't enjoy it as well.My guy loves the feel of it on his skin and his skin is less dry after shaving. Seems to be a slightly closer shave as well. I tested it on my legs and loved it, almost kept it.The bottle isn't large but so far it's lasted longer than expected. Probably would have gone faster had I kept using it on my legs.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Delicious smelling shave lotion
reviews.reviewText: I received this and my son in law tried it for me. We both agreed the smell is amazing , he said it smells like a candle but to me it smells like sugar cookies. He said it definitely gave him a smoother shave than regular shaving cream that he uses and his face felt much softer afterwards. He said he doesnt want a beauty routine but he could see himself using something like this so i let my daughter know where i got it !Definitely a winner !

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Nice pre-shave oil for men (or women)
reviews.reviewText: Hubby didn't particularly care for the vanilla scent, but it does fade quickly. My husband shaves daily and he applied this just before using his electric razor. He tells me he didn't notice that the shave was any better with the oil, but he liked the feel of the product on his face and felt like it protected his skin well. I gave it a try on my underarms and legs and found that I got a little better hair removal on my legs. Take note that you will also need to rinse your razor more frequently because the oil and hair will accumulate more than standard shaving gel. My legs felt very smooth and I didn't need to apply as much lotion afterwards.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Smells like food, shaves real close
reviews.reviewText: First of all, it smells great. Almost too good, I want to eat it, the forbidden pudding. Once you quash your desire to eat it and actually use it, the shave goes real well. It's thick and creamy and lathers up real nice, and you hardly need any. The blade moves smoothly, and doesn't irritate as much as shaving dry. The downside is that you have to rinse the hair off, because it gets caught up in the foam, but the upside is that thick hair doesn't fly all over the place and poke your eye out. But a bit more of a production than doing a trim over a trash can, dusting off, and calling it done. The extra work pays off, however, because the shave is much closer and smoother than without it. And it even leaves your skin real soft and moisturized. Overall I can't recommend it enough.This is a review for Striking Viking Shaving Cream for Men, Vanilla Scented (5.3 Oz) Shaving Cream Mens - Sensitive Skin Shaving Cream That Helps Moisturize, Protect and Soothe the Skin
